AI Team","details":"Each NFT represents a completed security audit with metadata stored on IPFS","errors":{"ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,address)":[{"details":"Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.","params":{"owner":"Address of the current owner of a token.","sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred.","tokenId":"Identifier number of a token."}}],"ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `operator`\u2019s approval. Used in transfers.","params":{"operator":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.","tokenId":"Identifier number of a token."}}],"ERC721InvalidApprover(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"approver":"Address initiating an approval operation."}}],"ERC721InvalidOperator(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"operator":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"ERC721InvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in ERC-721. Used in balance queries.","params":{"owner":"Address of the current owner of a token."}}],"ERC721InvalidReceiver(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.","params":{"receiver":"Address to which tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC721InvalidSender(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.","params":{"sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.","params":{"tokenId":"Identifier number of a token."}}],"InvalidAddress()":[{"details":"Custom errors for gas efficiency"}],"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token."},"ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool)":{"details":"Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets."},"BatchMetadataUpdate(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This event emits when the metadata of a range of tokens is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFTs."},"CertificateMinted(uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"contractAddress":"Address of the audited contract","reportId":"Associated vulnerability report ID","to":"Address that received the NFT","tokenId":"ID of the minted NFT"}},"CertificateRevoked(uint256,string)":{"params":{"reason":"Reason for revocation","tokenId":"ID of the revoked certificate"}},"MetadataUpdate(uint256)":{"details":"This event emits when the metadata of a token is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFT."},"MetadataUpdated(uint256,string)":{"params":{"newTokenURI":"New IPFS metadata URI","tokenId":"ID of the updated certificate"}},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gives permission to `to` to transfer `tokenId` token to another account. The approval is cleared when the token is transferred. Only a single account can be approved at a time, so approving the zero address clears previous approvals. Requirements: - The caller must own the token or be an approved operator. - `tokenId` must exist. Emits an {Approval} event."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Returns the number of tokens in ``owner``'s account."},"constructor":{"params":{"_securityRegistry":"Address of the SecurityRegistry contract","baseURI":"Base URI for token metadata","initialOwner":"Address that will own the contract"}},"getApproved(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the account approved for `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist."},"getCertificate(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"ID of the certificate"},"returns":{"auditTimestamp":"When the audit was completed","auditor":"Auditor identifier","contractAddress":"Address of the audited contract","isValid":"Certificate validity status","maxSeverity":"Maximum severity level found","reportId":"Associated vulnerability report ID"}},"getContractCertificates(address)":{"params":{"contractAddress":"Address of the contract"},"returns":{"_0":"tokenIds Array of certificate token IDs for the contract"}},"getSeverityColor(uint8)":{"params":{"severity":"Severity level (1=Low, 4=Critical)"},"returns":{"_0":"color Hex color code for the severity"}},"getSeverityLabel(uint8)":{"params":{"severity":"Severity level (1=Low, 4=Critical)"},"returns":{"_0":"label Human-readable severity label"}},"getValidCertificatesCount()":{"returns":{"count":"Number of valid certificates"}},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Returns if the `operator` is allowed to manage all of the assets of `owner`. See {setApprovalForAll}"},"mintCertificate(address,address,uint256,uint8,string,string)":{"params":{"auditor":"Auditor identifier","contractAddress":"Address of the audited contract","ipfsHash":"IPFS hash containing detailed audit metadata","maxSeverity":"Maximum severity level found","reportId":"Associated vulnerability report ID","to":"Address that will receive the NFT"},"returns":{"_0":"tokenId ID of the minted NFT"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the token collection name."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"ownerOf(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the owner of the `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"revokeCertificate(uint256,string)":{"details":"Only callable by contract owner or security registry","params":{"reason":"Reason for revocation","tokenId":"ID of the certificate to revoke"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`, checking first that contract recipients are aware of the ERC-721 protocol to prevent tokens from being forever locked. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been allowed to move this token by either {approve} or   {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event."},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Approve or remove `operator` as an operator for the caller. Operators can call {transferFrom} or {safeTransferFrom} for any token owned by the caller. Requirements: - The `operator` cannot be the address zero. Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event."},"setBaseTokenURI(string)":{"details":"Only callable by contract owner","params":{"baseURI":"New base URI for token metadata"}},"setChainGuardAddress(address)":{"details":"Only callable by contract owner","params":{"_chainGuard":"New ChainGuard address"}},"setSecurityRegistry(address)":{"details":"Only callable by contract owner","params":{"_securityRegistry":"New security registry address"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Override supportsInterface to include ERC721URIStorage"},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the token collection symbol."},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the URI for the token metadata"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. WARNING: Note that the caller is responsible to confirm that the recipient is capable of receiving ERC-721 or else they may be permanently lost. Usage of {safeTransferFrom} prevents loss, though the caller must understand this adds an external call which potentially creates a reentrancy vulnerability. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. Emits a {Transfer} event."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"updateMetadata(uint256,string)":{"details":"Only callable by certificate owner","params":{"ipfsHash":"New IPFS hash for metadata","tokenId":"ID of the certificate"}}},"title":"AuditNFT","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"CertificateMinted(uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an audit certificate NFT is minted"},"CertificateRevoked(uint256,string)":{"notice":"Emitted when a certificate is revoked"},"MetadataUpdated(uint256,string)":{"notice":"Emitted when certificate metadata is updated"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes the contract"},"getCertificate(uint256)":{"notice":"Get certificate details"},"getContractCertificates(address)":{"notice":"Get all certificates for a contract"},"getSeverityColor(uint8)":{"notice":"Get severity color for UI display"},"getSeverityLabel(uint8)":{"notice":"Get severity label"},"getValidCertificatesCount()":{"notice":"Get total number of valid certificates"},"mintCertificate(address,address,uint256,uint8,string,string)":{"notice":"Mint an audit certificate NFT (only callable by SecurityRegistry)"},"revokeCertificate(uint256,string)":{"notice":"Revoke an audit certificate"},"setBaseTokenURI(string)":{"notice":"Set base token URI"},"setChainGuardAddress(address)":{"notice":"Update the ChainGuard contract address"},"setSecurityRegistry(address)":{"notice":"Set security registry approve(address,uint256).details: Gives permission to `to` to transfer `tokenId` token to another account. The approval is cleared when the token is transferred. Only a single account can be approved at a time, so approving the zero address clears previous approvals. Requirements: - The caller must own the token or be an approved operator. - `tokenId` must exist. Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the number of tokens in ``owner``'s account.

params.initialOwner: Address that will own the contract

getApproved(uint256).details: Returns the account approved for `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

returns._0: tokenIds Array of certificate token IDs for the contract
color Hex color code for the severity

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns if the `operator` is allowed to manage all of the assets of `owner`. See {setApprovalForAll}

params.ipfsHash: IPFS hash containing detailed audit metadata
params.to: Address that will receive the NFT

returns._0: tokenId ID of the minted NFT

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

ownerOf(uint256).details: Returns the owner of the `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokeCertificate(uint256,string).details: Only callable by contract owner or security registry

params.tokenId: ID of the certificate to revoke

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`, checking first that contract recipients are aware of the ERC-721 protocol to prevent tokens from being forever locked. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been allowed to move this token by either {approve} or   {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Approve or remove `operator` as an operator for the caller. Operators can call {transferFrom} or {safeTransferFrom} for any token owned by the caller. Requirements: - The `operator` cannot be the address zero. Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event.

params.baseURI: New base URI for token metadata

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns the URI for the token metadata

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. WARNING: Note that the caller is responsible to confirm that the recipient is capable of receiving ERC-721 or else they may be permanently lost. Usage of {safeTransferFrom} prevents loss, though the caller must understand this adds an external call which potentially creates a reentrancy vulnerability. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

getContractCertificates(address).notice: Get all certificates for a contract

getSeverityColor(uint8).notice: Get severity color for UI display

getValidCertificatesCount().notice: Get total number of valid certificates

mintCertificate(address,address,uint256,.notice: Mint an audit certificate NFT (only callable by SecurityRegistry)
